content:
Diagnosis
	1. Prostate adenocarcinoma with mixed features, left zone predominant
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	Not indicated - locally advanced at presentation

	Radiotherapy
	15 Feb 2024 - 22 Mar 2024
	Radical IMRT 74Gy in 37 fractions to prostate and pelvic nodes

	Systemic therapy
	Luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone (LHRH) analogue commenced 12 Jan 2024
	Bicalutamide 50mg daily 12-26 Jan 2024
	Olaparib 300mg BD commenced 1 Apr 2024 following confirmation of ATM mutation

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Stable biochemical response

	Current issues
	Grade 2 fatigue
Mild gastrointestinal symptoms

	Summary of consultation
	Reviewed today for assessment of tolerance to Olaparib therapy. PSA has decreased from 89.4 to 12.3 since January. Performance status remains 1. Main side effects are fatigue and intermittent nausea, both manageable with current supportive measures. Blood counts stable with mild anaemia (Hb 118). No dose modifications required.

	Further investigations
	PSA and FBC/U&E in 4 weeks

	Medication prescribed
	Continue Olaparib 300mg BD
Continue LHRH analogue

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 4 weeks with blood results

	Required GP actions
	None required

	Summary of information given to patient
	Discussed stable disease status and good tolerability of current treatment. Patient understands to contact if side effects worsen.

cancer_timeline.value: Completed radical IMRT 74Gy in 37 fractions to prostate and pelvic nodes
Started Olaparib 300mg BD following confirmation of ATM mutation

status_updates.value: Locally advanced prostate cancer with nodal involvement showing good biochemical response to combined modality treatment including LHRH analogue, radiotherapy and targeted therapy with Olaparib
Grade 2 fatigue and mild nausea, both manageable with supportive care
Continuing Olaparib 300mg BD and LHRH analogue with no dose modifications required
Oncology review in 4 weeks with blood results
